You are here:

SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
VISUALFORCE B2B COMMERCE RELEASE NOTES AND UPGRADE GUIDE
Account for CSR Permission Set Changes

The B2B Commerce CSR permission set that the managed package installs now includes updated Visualforce page access, object settings, and Apex class permissions. These changes address gaps in the permission set that sometimes caused parts of the customer service representative (CSR) flow to not function correctly.

Where: This change applies to B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’19 (version 4.11) in Lightning Experience and Salesforce Classic in Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions.

How: If you previously cloned the default B2B Commerce CSR or CloudCraze CSR permission set, update permissions on the cloned permission set:

Add access to the following Visualforce pages:
ccrz.Checkout
ccrz.CheckoutNew
ccrz.Homepage
ccrz.PageLabels
ccrz.ProductCompare
ccrz.ProductList
ccrz.cc_admin_CSRFlow
Update the following objects to include View All and Modify All permissions:
CC Carts
CC Cart Coupons
CC Contact Addresses
CC Cart Coupons
CC Invoices
CC Orders
CC Stored Payments
CC Subscriptions
CC Transaction Payments
Add the following Apex classes to the list of Enabled Apex Classes:
ccrz.cc_ctrl_Formatter
ccrz.cc_Util_Order

To grant permission for activities that CSRs perform on behalf of buyers, update the custom user profile assigned to your registered storefront users. For each of the following objects, update the profile's object permissions to enable Create, Read, Edit, and Delete operations:

CC Contact Addresses
CC Invoices
CC Subscriptions
CC Stored Payments
CC Transaction Payments
SEE ALSO
Allow a Customer Service Representative to Log In to a Storefront on Behalf of a Buyer
